section.p:

Anyway, like I was sayin', shrimp is the fruit of the sea. You can barbecue it, boil it, broil it, bake it, sautee it. Dey's uh, shrimp-kabobs, shrimp creole, shrimp gumbo. A number of in-line elements are available in the DTD, we will show them inside an unordered list (<ul>):

ul.li: Here is a simple list item (<li>).
Have you seen the use of the <code> element in the previous item?
Also, we have <sub> and <sup> elements to show content above or below the text baseline.
There is a facility to emphasize certain words using the <em> <strong> elements.
Another possibility is the element: , which offers the ability to refer to an image map.

We have elements for hyperlinking:
<a href="faq.html"> Use this to link to another document. As per normal, this will open the new document in the same browser window.
<a href="#section"> Use this to link to the named anchor in the current document.
<a href="faq.html#forrest"> Use this to link to another document and go to the named anchor. This will open the new document in the same browser window.
Targetted window control with jump and fork. See demonstration using class attribute on links.

section.title: Various presentation formats
section.p: This sample document, written in document-v20 XML can be presented via Forrest in a number of different formats. The links in the following list show this document in each of the currently available formats.

Each of the formats can be made available as a link near the top of the page. Actual placement of those links depends on the skin currently in use. Those links are enabled in the skinconf.xml via the <disable-XXX-link> elements in the skinconf.xml

section.title: Using class attribute on links
section.p: The document-v13 had elements <fork> and <jump>. In document-v20, those elements no longer exist but the functionality can be duplicated by using the @class attribute. Even though the opening of separate windows should be under the control of the user, these techniques can still be employed.

section.p:
See the generated
DTD reference documentation.

ul.li: Removed <fork> and <jump> in favour of the <a> element. See demonstration using class attribute on links.

section.title: Changes between document-v12 and document-v13
section.p: All v1.2 docs will work fine as v1.3 DTD. The main change is the addition of a @class attribute to every element, which enables the "extra-css" section in the skinconf to be put to good use.

section.title: Changes between document-v11 and document-v12
section.p: doc-v12 enhances doc-v11 by relaxing various restrictions that were found to be unnecessary.

ul.li: Links ((link|jump|fork) and inline elements (br|img|icon|acronym) are allowed inside title.
Paragraphs (p|source|note|warning|fixme), table and figure|anchor are allowed inside li.
Paragraphs (p|source|note|warning|fixme), lists (ol|ul|dl), table, figure|anchor are allowed inside definition lists (dd) and tables (td and dh).
Inline content (strong|em|code|sub|sup|br|img|icon|acronym|link|jump|fork) is allowed in strong and em.
